oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Two couples in a Hudson automobile at the Parthenon, Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1910
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two elegant couples seated in a Hudson automobile, in front of the Parthenon in Nashville, Tennessee, circa 1910. A finely dressed woman is seated in the front seat at the right-hand wheel steering of this automobile model, alongside a man wearing a dapper straw hat. Another well-dressed couple is seated in the back seat. The Hudson automobile was made by Hudson Motor Car Company, manufactured in Detroit, Michigan. Forms part of Mrs. Libbie (Walsh) Teachout Papers. 1 sepia photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Teachout family; Walsh family
